H0.text: chemicals produced in one part of a plant that affect the growth and response of other parts. Auxins

H1.text: chemicals produced in one part of a plant that affect the growth and response of other parts. Enzymes

H2.text: chemicals produced in one part of a plant that affect the growth and response of other parts. Nutrients

H3.text: chemicals produced in one part of a plant that affect the growth and response of other parts. hormones

A4.text: Auxin is a growth-promoting hormone that becomes asymmetrically distributed in the bending region.

A5.text: Auxins typically act in concert with, or in opposition to, other plant hormones.

A6.text: Plant hormones (or phytohormones) are signal molecules, produced within plants, that occur in extremely low concentrations.

A7.text: Plant hormones frequently regulate the concentrations of other plant hormones.
